VEC.Q: How many ridgelines are in this ridgeline chart?
VEC.A: There are {6} slices in this chart.

SRP.Q: What is the spatial relationship of the peak of Mountain Regions relative to the peak of Urban Redevelopment Areas in terms of vertical (above/below) and horizontal (left/right) directions?
SRP.A: The peak of  Mountain Regions is to the {right} of the peak of Urban Redevelopment Areas.

VPR.Q: What distribution pattern does the ridgeline representing Rural Areas show?
VPR.A: The ridgeline representing Rural Areas shows a {Single Peak Distribution}.

VPR.Q: At what value do  Urban Redevelopment Areas reach its peaks?

EVJ.Q: Which ridgeline has the highest peak
EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Rural Areas} has the highest peak.

EVJ.Q: Which label has the highest density at X =239013.4?
EVJ.A: At X =239013.4,the label with the highest density is {Rural Areas}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 508045? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Mountain Regions}'s peak at {857858},{Coastal Properties}'s peak at {857858},{Luxury Residences}'s peak at {838839}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks below 381913? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Urban Redevelopment Areas}'s peak at {156156},{Metropolitan Areas}'s peak at {117117},{Rural Areas}'s peak at {150150}

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Coastal Properties or Mountain Regions?
NC.A: {Mountain Regions} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Luxury Residences or Metropolitan Areas?
NC.A: {Luxury Residences} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {3} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Rural Areas}
